title: Smart City Infrastructure Management: Practical Construction of a Water Meter Failure Prediction System

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational urban infrastructure management knowledge, intermediate-level data analysis experience, and practical experience in public service data processing
context.additional_context: Blended education supporting smartphone-based learning in local government settings with limited real-time data access. Project-based learning focused on solving community issues and improving public services.

learning_goals: Execute data quality verification procedures for fault prediction model construction in urban infrastructure maintenance with 80% accuracy.

Over a six-month course, learners can optimize 5 hyperparameters (batch size, learning rate, hidden layer size, etc.) of RNN-based classification models (e.g., LSTM, GRU) by applying them to real industrial data (e.g., smart meter time-series forecasting, urban service data processing) and build models achieving ≥85% accuracy on validation datasets.
Apply time-series data analysis methodologies for identifying water meter fault patterns to improve urban resource management efficiency.
Conduct model performance evaluations on mobile devices in limited technical environments and analyze field applicability.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
